00030   $Id: rumtask.c,v 1.1 2009/05/20 20:52:01 mvidales Exp $

00033 // Utasker
00034 #include "config.h"
00035 
00036 #include "mac_event.h"
00037 #include "arm_app.h"
00038 #include "system.h"
00039 #include "arm_timer.h"
00040 #include "arm_timer_event.h"
00041 
00042 
00043 // ---------- Implementation ----------
00050 extern void fnTaskRUM(TTASKTABLE *ptrTaskTable)
00051 {
00052     static int iState = 0;
00053     volatile USOCKET Socket;
00054 
00055     // Only do the initialization 1 time.
00056     if(!iState)
00057     {
00058         iState = 1;
00059 
00060         // Print out our IP address to the serial port when enabled.
00061         CHAR cBuf[16];
00062         fnDebugMsg("IP address = ");
00063         fnIPStr(&network.ucOurIP[0], cBuf);
00064         fnDebugMsg(cBuf);
00065 
00066         // Init the app.
00067         appInit();
00068 
00069         fnDebugMsg("\r\nRUM Tasking activated... \r\n ");
00070 
00071         // Set up the timer used for the application.
00072         timerInit();
00073         timerStart();
00074 
00075         // Get TCP Socket and listen on FTP control port, INFINITE_TIMEOUT
00076         // (0xFFFF) timeout means never timeout.
00077         Socket = fnGetTCP_Socket(TOS_MINIMISE_DELAY, INFINITE_TIMEOUT, tcpListener);
00078 
00079         // For functions in other files expose the Socket as global host_socket.
00080         host_socket = Socket;
00081 
00082         // Listen on port 6464 (a server listens) and the '0' parameter says
00083         // to use the maximum window size a connection can accept.
00084         host_socket2 = fnTCP_Listen(host_socket, TCP_PORT, 0);
00085 
00086         // Create a file on the SD card for recording data.
00087         armAppInit();
00088     }
00089 
00090     // Call mac event
00091     macTask();
00092 
00093     // Call timer task.
00094     timerTask();
00095 }
Generated on Mon Jun 8 18:38:19 2009 for RUM by  1.5.5
